title.narrative: 05-02 MANAGEMENT OF THE EDUCATIION SYST

description.narrative: By 2017, the management, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of the implementation of the Education Sectorial Programme at central, decentralized and community levels are supported by reliable statistical data, disaggregated by sex and area of residence (rural / urban), produced and disseminated in time, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, 15% of preschool children have access to quality early childhood education 70% of school-age children are enrolled in primary school and at least 40% of 12 years children complete a full cycle of primary school parity between boys and girls is realized for related indicators

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, the management, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of the implementation of the Education Sectorial Programme atcentral, decentralized and community levels are supported by reliable statistical data, disaggregated by sex and area of residence(rural / urban), produced and disseminated in time

description.narrative: The management of the education system was improved including a permanent dialogue with partners through the Education Sector Group (ESG) and thematic groups, although not all of them are functional. The experimentation of data collection via tablets gave positive results and paves the way for generalization in 2018 | Status:Met | As-of Date:13/12/2017
